dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4181 IH: Wildfire Infrastructure and Landowner Tax Relief Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Issa (for himself, Mr. Baumgartner, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Newhouse, and Mr. LaMalfa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide incentives for wildfire prevention.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Wildfire Infrastructure and Landowner Tax Relief Act of 2025 or the WILTR Act of 2025.

section.header: Exclusion of gross income related to hazardous fuel reduction activities

subsection.text: Section 139 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Hazardous fuel reduction activities on and improvements to real property

paragraph.text: Gross income shall not include any grant or award received by a taxpayer or services provided to the taxpayer for the purpose of conducting hazardous fuel reduction activities on or hazardous fuel reduction improvements to the real property of such taxpayer.

subparagraph.text: The term hazardous fuel reduction activity means an activity the purpose of which is wildfire prevention through—

subclause.text: a natural or manmade change in fuel characteristics that affects fire behavior such that a fire can be more readily controlled (commonly known as a fuel break), or
a natural or constructed barrier used to stop or check a fire or to provide a control line from which to work to stop or check a fire (commonly known as a firebreak), or
the use of mechanical methods such as crushing, tractor and hand piling, thinning, pruning, cutting, or otherwise removing hazardous fuels.

subparagraph.text: The term hazardous fuel reduction improvement means additions or alterations to real property the purpose of which is to enable firefighting preparation, training, access, or fire suppression or emergency evacuation relating to fire, including—

clause.text: the installation of firefighting equipment or infrastructure,
the maintenance, expansion, or alteration of trails or roads for the purposes of firefighting access or fire-related evacuation, and
the facilitation of firefighter training on such real property.

subparagraph.text: The term hazardous fuel means any vegetative material that is susceptible to burning, including—

clause.text: any dead vegetative material on or near the ground.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to amounts received after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Treatment of expenditures in connection with hazardous fuel reduction activities or improvements

subsection.text: Part VI of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after section 199A the following new section:

section.header: Deduction for hazardous fuel reduction activities or improvements

subsection.text: There shall be allowed as a deduction an amount equal to the amounts paid or incurred by the taxpayer for qualified hazardous fuel reduction activities during the taxable year.
For purposes of this section, the term qualified hazardous fuel reduction activities means improvements to the real property of the taxpayer which—

paragraph.text: is a hazardous fuel reduction activity or hazardous fuel reduction improvement described in section 139(i)(2), and

a State, local, Tribal, or Federal fire management agency certifies will reduce hazardous fuels or enable firefighting preparation, training, access, or fire suppression or emergency evacuation relating to fire.

subsection.text: No deduction shall be allowed under subsection (a) with respect to any expenditure to the extent that an amount is excludable under section 139(i) with respect to such expenditure.

subsection.header: Deduction taken into account in determining adjusted gross income
subsection.text: Section 62(a) of such Code is amended by inserting after paragraph (21) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Expenditures in connection with qualified hazardous fuel reduction activities

paragraph.text: Section 263(a)(1) of such Code is amended by striking or at the end of subparagraph (J), by striking the period at the end of subparagraph (K) and inserting , or, and by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: expenditures for which a deduction is allowed under section 200.

paragraph.text: The table of sections for part VI of subchapter B of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 199A the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 199B. Deduction for hazardous fuel reduction activities or improvements.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts paid or incurred after the date of the enactment of this Act.
